messages.message:
Some nit-feedbacks on the Settings page in both Converse and Build!
1. The settings action area is on the extreme left and close, save etc are on the extreme right. On a large monitor this is 2-3 drags away from the config area.
2.  The 'Cancel', 'X' and 'Settings' all do the same action when you are in the settings page.
If this is considering any other scenarios and need to be there, at least key 'esc' to close would be very user friendly!

@Paul H since Siya is OOO until next week

was there a particular reason for having the setting actions and the close/save far away from each other?

https://www.interaction-design.org/literature/topics/fitts-law

This is a great example of Fits Law in practice

> was there a particular reason for having the setting actions and the close/save far away from each other?
We have a button that appears under the settings option when a setting is changed, so putting the other buttons on the bottom right reduces the clutter and keeps consistency with other modal-like actions.

However, this is not a immutable position â€” we want this type of feedback! I agree that having the buttons closer together will make the experience more cohesive and intuitive. Let me track this.
